comments.text:
Hi everyone! Here's a follow up to my last soil blocking video which you can watch here if you haven't already- https://youtu.be/ByLv8lVglj8

This new one covers what can go wrong when making soil blocks and I also demonstrate how to make them using a smaller, more affordable soil blocker if you're sowing seeds on a smaller scale than I am.
comments.author: @joegardenerTV

comments.text: Anything you can teach on soil blocking is great! I bought  a soil blocker but nervous to use it because of all of the negative videos about them and the lack of good how to videos.
comments.author: @laurasgardensanctuary

comments.text: Thank you.  I picked up some great tips, even the use of a gooseneck watering bottle. You're easy to learn from. I discovered you when you set up your beautiful greenhouse.
comments.author: @gailzharv

comments.text: I bought the swift nanos because of your video. Thx! Some of your links are bad, unavailable, the soil mixing tub for one. That can be picked up at Home Depot for $8.00! It’s called a cement mixing tub.
comments.author: @debsmith8102

comments.text:
I have those 4 and 5 blocks and the mini blocker. I like the idea and it create nice blocks. But for some reason the roots cannot penetrate the blocks despite the are wet enough, even to wet for my feelings. 
Triede many soil recipe ...
comments.author: @jakehohoho7534

comments.text:
I've never had an issue with my small size soil blocks.
Only squash, cukes and melons get a larger size soil block.
I always sift before using.  I use a very moist soil and a spatula to make sure the material is well packed into the maker. 
Each year I get better at timing so I go straight to the garden and skip potting up to a pot.
Always double check if my seed does (or does not) want heat mat or light. Never let my cat walk across the seeds😂 and water slowly on the side, draining off anything left in the tray after 5 minutes.
comments.author: @victorialg1270

comments.text: Can you confirm using BX picking out bigger chunks? The screening thing threw me whether it is a necessary step or not.
comments.author: @billsnyder6945

comments.text:
What a timely video for me, as I prepare to get the garden going again.  I’m determined to rid myself of depending on plastic as much as I can.  Thank you for all of these golden nuggets of helpful information.
On a side note, I was surprised to find out that you incorporate a product that contains peat moss in your seed starting.  Any thoughts on that?
I appreciate you sharing your knowledge with us.  Blessings to you and all who visit here.
comments.author: @daisygurl3601
